info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 2:25PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Albany, northwestern Greene and southeastern Schoharie Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 224 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Gilboa, or 16 miles northwest of Hunter, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rains could cause ponding of water on roadways. Locations impacted include... Gilboa, Prattsville, Livingstonville, North Blenheim, Preston-Potter Hollow, Preston Hollow, Durham, Conesville, West Settlement, East Durham, Huntersland, Manorkill, Broome Center, Five Corners, Four Corners, North Settlement, West Conesville, Red Falls, Oak Hill and South Gilboa. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
